name: Writing and Reading metro – Quiz 1
description: Practice vocabulary related to public transportation and the metro through writing and reading exercises.

questions.question: How do you say
questions.explanation: About 70% of French people living in cities of more than 50 000 inhabitants use public transportation (bus, subway, tramway, train…).

questions.question: How do you say "metro line"?
questions.explanation: that is itself short for « chemin de fer métropolitain » which means city railroad.

questions.question: How do you say "subway map"?
questions.explanation: The first Parisian subway map was created in 1900 with the opening of Line 1, which linked Porte Maillot to Porte de Vincennes.

questions.question: How do you say
options: A. Un ticket s'il vous plait ?
B. Un ticket s'il te plait ?
questions.correctAnswer: A. Un ticket s'il vous plait ?
questions.explanation: You need a ticket to get into the subway and most times to exit as well. It's best to keep it with you until you exit.

questions.question: How do you say
options: A. Près de 4 millions de passagers
questions.explanation: Approximately 4 million passengers use the Paris Metro every day.

questions.question: How do you say
options: A. La ligne de métro 6 relie Charles de Gaulle-Étoile à Nation.
B. La ligne 6 relie Charles de Gaulle-Étoile à Nation.
C. La ligne de métro 6 circule entre Charles de Gaulle-Étoile et Nation.
questions.explanation: Lines are primarily numbered 1 to 16 (with a few exceptions like 3bis and 7bis). Higher numbers generally correspond to lines built later, often serving outer suburbs.

questions.question: How do you say
options: A. Une métro toutes les 2 à 5 minutes
B. Une station tous les 2 à 5 minutes
C. Un métro toutes les 2 à 5 minutes
D. Un métro entres 2 à 5 minutes
questions.correctAnswer: C. Un métro toutes les 2 à 5 minutes
questions.explanation: In Paris, A metro is expected every 2 to 5 minutes.

questions.question: How do you say "The first metro is at 5:30 AM
options: A. Le premier métro est à 5h30.
B. Le premier métro est à cinq heures trente.
C. Le premier métro est à cinq heures et demie du matin.
questions.explanation: It's more common to say du matin after 5h30 but people will understand nonetheless since you are talking about the first metro.

questions.question: How do you say "What time is the last metro leaving"?
options: A. À quelle heure est le dernier métro ?
B. À telle heure est le dernier métro ?
C. À comment heure est le dernier métro ?
questions.correctAnswer: A. À quelle heure est le dernier métro ?
questions.explanation: In Paris, the last metro of the day is scheduled to depart around 12:30 AM to 12:40 AM from Thursday to Sunday. On Fridays, Saturdays, and eves of holidays, it is between 1:30 AM and 1:40 AM approximately.

questions.question: How do you say "how to get to the Louvre Museum please
options: A. Comment puis-je me rendre au Louvre s'il vous plait ?
B. Comment se rendre au Louvre s'il vous plait ?
C. Comment aller au Louvre s'il vous plait ?
questions.explanation: There are three stations that serve the Louvre Museum in Paris, the closest being Palais Royal-Musée du louvre
